import React from "react"; import {Helmet} from "react-helmet"; class B53 extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props); this.state = { data: [], phone: "", }; } componentWillMount() { } render() { return (
  • All Articles
  • Algorithmic Trading
  • Technical Analysis
  • Stock Markets
  • Algolab
  • SMART Marketplace
  • Home
  • Blog
  • SMART Marketplace
  • What are the benefits of using SMART Algorithms?
What are the benefits of using SMART Algorithms?
{" "} What are the benefits of using SMART Algorithms?{" "}


SMART Algorithm {" "} trade in an extremely will disciplined manner following the rules of the algorithm strictly. These do not have any emotional component attached and hence can provide an edge over traditional trading methods. Also, these have been tested over historical data and one can just the quality of each in the same manner as one does for mutual funds. Users don't need to manually interfere at any point of time after subscribing to a SMART Algorithm.

Benefits of SMART trading

The popularity of{" "} algorithmic Trading {" "} have gone off the roof in the last few years, majorly accounting to it’s number of advantages over{" "} {" "} manual trading . Algo trading have been here for years but the many players (traders/investors) still doesn’t know about the advantages of machine (or computer) trading over a human. In basic context, it is basic comparison of a human to a machine, which is often taught in class 3. So, let’s cover it one at a time and see how and why algo-trading is becoming one of the greatest trends in{" "} {" "} stock market {" "} history.

1. Fatigue:
It is one of the major reasons behind less productivity everywhere. Every human feels tired and fatigue and can never be productive to his 100% ability. Thus, it becomes a major superiority or advantage of a piece of program over a human. A computer can scan and execute multiple indicators at a speed than is beyond our working capabilities. More trade means more opportunities and which can lead to more returns, which is the ultimate desire of any trader or investor.

2. Emotional Bias:
One thing that sets apart a human from a machine is his ability to have and show emotions. Being an advantage in many real-life scenarios, it can sometimes work against you, especially when you are trading and needs more rational thinking and less emotional bias.{" "} Algo trading {" "} can be an expert in this region. Without any emotional bias, algo-trading follows a certain set of instructions and stick to it.

3. Accuracy:
Computers are way more accurate when it comes to executing a set of rules. Rationally, no one will move to a less accurate option, when a large amount of money is at stake. Making more profits is way easier when you can avoid a lot of pitfalls because of human mistakes while executing trades.

4. Reduced Transaction cost:
Without the constant supervision of humans, computer programs can work for a large duration and thus reduces the cost of human resources. Less cost on each trade certainly improves your chances of making more return on your investment. This makes algo trading more attractive to many traders around the world.

5. Ability to backtest:
{" "} Backtesting {" "} is a piece of program to help traders to measure the effectiveness of trading strategies. Generally, a{" "} strategy {" "} effectiveness (how a strategy would have performed) is measured on the historical data and it is assumed that if it is doing well on the historical or past data, it might work well on future trades as well. This gives the traders a huge opportunity to test and play around a number of strategies and remove any error from the trading system before it starts executing trades in real world.

So, in brief, I would say though many risk factors are still associated to it (it is not 100% safe), but it is always better to explore more about new techniques and trends emerging in the{" "} {" "} stock market {" "} and especially{" "} algorithmic Trading , and get a competitive advantage over other traders in the market.

To do backtesting click on:{" "} SMART algorithm

)}} export default B53;
